description: Indore is the largest city in Madhya Pradesh, known for its rich history, vibrant culture, and economic significance.
highlights: Indore is the commercial and education hub of Madhya Pradesh.
Indore has been named India's cleanest city seven years in a row, from 2017 to 2023.
Indore has been selected as one of the 100 Indian cities to be developed as a smart city under the Smart Cities Mission.
Indore is also the first city in India to ban begging.

history.historical_significance: Indore was founded as a trade hub by local landowners in the 16th century and later developed under the Holkar dynasty. It played a key role in the Maratha Empire.

important_events.event: Became a princely state under British rule.

geography.climate: Humid subtropical with hot summers and mild winters.

universities.description: A premier institute for technology and engineering studies.

universities.name: IIM Indore
universities.description: One of India's top business schools.

bus_services.description: A rapid transit bus service for easy city commuting.
Regular bus services connecting different parts of Indore.
A metro rail project under construction, expected to improve connectivity.

tourist_spots.name: Lal Baag Palace

tourist_spots.name: Sarafa Bazaar
tourist_spots.description: A famous night food market serving a variety of local delicacies.

tourist_spots.name: Chappan Dukan

stadiums.description: Hosts national football and athletics events.

temples.name: Khajrana Ganesh Temple
temples.location: Ganeshpuri Main Rd, Ganeshpuri, Khajrana, Indore, Madhya Pradesh
temples.description: The temple is dedicated to Lord Ganesha, built by Ahilyabai Holkar.

temples.name: Pitra Parvat
temples.description: The statue of Hanuman in Pitreshwar Temple is an impressive 72 feet tall and weighs 108 tons, making it the largest idol in Indore

temples.name: Bada Ganpati Temple
temples.description: This holy site has been aptly named as it has the world's biggest idol of Lord Ganesha – the God of Happiness and Prosperity, measuring 25 ft. from foot to crown.

temples.name: Bijasan Mata Temple
temples.location: Devi Ahillyabai Holkar Airport Area, Indore, Madhya Pradesh
temples.description: Bijasan Mata Temple is dedicated to the Hindu goddess Durga, who is worshipped as the mother of good fortune

temples.name: Kanch Temple
temples.description: The temple holds significant religious importance for followers of Jainism.

temples.name: Annapurna Temple
temples.location: Kranti Kriplani Nagar, Indore, Madhya Pradesh
temples.description: The temple is dedicated to Goddess Annapurna, who is revered as the deity of food.It is inspired by Meenakshi Temple in Madurai.

weather.summer: March to June, hot with temperatures ranging from 25°C to 45°C.
weather.monsoon: July to September, moderate to heavy rainfall.
weather.winter: October to February, mild and pleasant, 8°C to 25°C.

Local_Tips.Traffic_Tips: Avoid MG Road during peak hours
Local_Tips.Dos_Donts: Try local street food but ensure hygiene

Hospitals.address: Mahatma Gandhi Memorial Medical College, Indore

faq.question: What is Indore known for?
faq.answer: Indore is known for its historical architecture, vibrant food scene, and being one of the cleanest cities in India.

faq.question: What are some of the top attractions in Indore?
faq.answer: The Rajwada, Lal Bagh Palace, Sarafa Bazaar, and Chappan Dukan are some of the top attractions in Indore.

faq.question: What is the best time to visit Indore?
faq.answer: The best time to visit Indore is from October to February when the weather is pleasant and there are many cultural festivals.

faq.question: What are some of the unique features of Indore?
faq.answer: Indore is the only city in India to have campuses of both the Indian Institute of Technology and the Indian Institute of Management.

faq.question: What is Indore's role in the state of Madhya Pradesh?
faq.answer: Indore is the largest city in Madhya Pradesh and is the state's commercial and cultural hub. It is also the headquarters of the Indore District and Indore Division.
